title: Electrostatics - effect of charge on force

content.question: In the original configuration of the three charged particles, Particle <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> experiences a force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> from Particle <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> only. If the magnitude of the charge of Particle <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is changed to <math alttext="2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math>, what is the new force on Particle <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> from Particle <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> only?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
